Package controller

Class AppManager

java.lang.Object
view.AppMenu
controller.AppManager
public class AppManager extends AppMenu
A class to manage the application's toy inventory. Extends AppMenu class to inherit the menu interface for user interaction.

  • Constructor Summary

    AppManager()
    Constructor to create an instance of AppManager and load toy data from the text file.

  • Constructor Details

    • AppManager

      public AppManager()
      Constructor to create an instance of AppManager and load toy data from the text file.

  • Method Details

    • loadFile

      public static void loadFile()
      Method to load toy data from the text file and create Toy objects. Uses BufferedReader and FileReader objects to read from the text file. Each line of the text file is split into an array of Strings to create Toy objects. Toy objects are added to the ArrayList. If any error occurs during file reading, it is printed to the console.

    • saveFile

      public static void saveFile()
      Method to save toy data to the text file. Uses FileWriter and PrintWriter objects to write to the text file. Each Toy object in the ArrayList is formatted into a String using the format method of the Toy class. The formatted String is written to the text file. If any error occurs during file writing, it is printed to the console.

    • purchaseName

      public static void purchaseName()
      Method to purchase a toy by its name This method prompts the user to input a name of the toy they wish to purchase. It then searches the array list of toys for a match to the input name. If a match is found, it displays the list of toys with the matching name, and prompts the user to choose which toy they want to purchase. If the selected toy is in stock, it decreases the count by 1, and saves the updated list to the text file. If no toy with the matching name is found, the method displays an appropriate message and calls itself recursively until a toy is found.
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the user inputs an invalid index for the selected toy
      InputMismatchException - if the user inputs a non-integer value for the toy selection

    • purchaseS_N

      public static void purchaseS_N()
      Allows the user to purchase a toy by entering the serial number of the toy. If the toy is found, the user is prompted to choose which toy they want to purchase. Once a toy is chosen, the count of that toy is decremented and the file is saved. If the toy is not found, the user is prompted again to enter a valid serial number.
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the user enters an invalid index
      InputMismatchException - if the user enters an invalid input
      Exception - for any other type of exception

    • purchaseType

      public static void purchaseType()
      Allows user to select a toy type to purchase from the inventory. Retrieves all toys of the specified type from the ArrayList. Prompts user to select a toy from the list and decrements the count of that toy by 1 upon purchase. Saves updated inventory to file after purchase.
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if user enters an invalid index for toy selection.
      InputMismatchException - if user enters input of the wrong type for toy selection.

    • inputSN

      public static String inputSN()
      This method prompts the user to input a serial number and validates it by checking if it is a 10-digit number. If the input is invalid, the method recursively calls itself to prompt the user again. If the input is valid, it returns the input as a string.
      Returns:
      the validated serial number input as a string.

    • addFigures

      public static void addFigures(String SN)
      This method adds new Figures object to the arrList.
      Parameters:
      SN - the serial number of the figure
      Throws:
      CustomExeptionClass - when there is an issue with adding the figure

    • remove

      public static void remove()
      Allows the user to remove a toy from the inventory based on the toy's serial number. If the serial number entered by the user is not a 10-digit number or contains non-digit characters, the user is prompted to re-enter the serial number. If the serial number entered by the user is not found in the inventory, the user is notified and prompted to try again. If the serial number entered by the user is found, the user is prompted to confirm the deletion. If the user confirms the deletion, the toy is removed from the inventory and the updated inventory is displayed. If the user selects an invalid option, they are prompted to select again.
